title: Comparing ABA Therapy Efficacy: Relational Training (RT) vs. Treatment as Usual (TAU)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy concepts and foundational language development theories
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning for working professionals, aimed at enhancing practical understanding of comparative treatment effectiveness for children with autism.

learning_goals: Explain the theoretical differences between RT (Responsive Teaching) and TAU (Treatment as Usual) and their therapeutic approaches with over 80% accuracy
Present at least three analytical frameworks comparing the effectiveness of ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis) therapy based on research findings
Specify at least two RT-based language intervention strategies applicable to educational settings

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
